body:
Hi Sylvia,


can you determine, what the "bottleneck" is? is it the illuminance 
calcualtion at the beginning or the image calculation?
I guess you made also normal illumianance calculations first - how long 
did they take?
If the illuminance calc is the bottleneck, then the ambient parameters 
reduce the time. but you are already at a low limit, especially 
regarding ad and as.
In general it is more important to have a high ad than having a very low 
aa. So I would say you could incread aa to 0.2. But I usually calculate 
ad with 8192 or double... - this increases the time then again.
The ambient parameters effect only the illuminace calculation in the 
first step - the calculation of the images is using ab 0 and cannot be 
changed by the user.


I guess you are using windows which is in general a problem, since it is 
not possible right now to use more than one cpu at the same time. I have 
a linux version running here and usually distribute jobs to 10-40 cores...


best regards
jan




On 10/25/2013 01:36 PM, Cammarano Silvia wrote:
> Hi Jan,
> thank you very much for your reply.
> Yes, I used a .vf file format with two calculation points (two lines).
> The calculation at the end works but it's very slow. I'm using the advanced dynamic shading device model, the time-step is 15 minutes and the Radiance parameters are: ab = 5; ad = 1000; as = 20; ar = 300; aa = 0.1.
> During the simulation some warnings about the vertical illuminance below 100 lux (out of range for DGP calculation) or low brightness scene appear.
> Do you think I should change the Radiance parameters to have a faster calculation?
>
>
> Silvia
>
>
> arch. Silvia Cammarano
> PhD student in Energetics

> Inviato: mercoledì 23 ottobre 2013 19:07
> A: silvia.cammarano at polito.it; DAYSIM discussion
> Oggetto: Re: [Radiance-daysim] DGP calculation in Daysim
> Priorità: Alta
>
> Hi Silvia,
>
> the viewpoitfile must have the same format as a viewpoint file for rpict or rvu (*.vf). Multiple lines correspond to multiple calculation points.
> Hope that helps, if not, is there any error message?
>
> good luck,
> Jan
>
> Am 2013-10-23 18:01, schrieb Cammarano Silvia:
>> Hi folks!
>>
>> I'm trying to calculate the annual DGP profile using Daysim but I'm
>> having troubles setting the right Viewpoint File. I'm using the
>> advanced dynamic shading model. I think to have properly set the
>> shading device geometry and material since Daysim can calculate
>> illuminances for both up and down shading status. At the end of the
>> simulation the .dgp file is empty.
>>
>> Can anyone help me?
>>
>> Thanks a lot!
>>
>> Cheers,
>>
>> Silvia
>>
